summary: "Watership Down" is a book by Richard Adams about a group of rabbits in England. They live like humans, with their own language and stories. When their home is in danger, they go on an adventure to find a new place to live. Along the way, they face many challenges. It was Adams' first book, and it won several awards. It was also made into a movie, a TV show, and a drama. Adams later wrote a book of short stories about the rabbits called "Tales from Watership Down."
title: Watership Down
